job_title: Executive Director in North Canton, OH
pros: Nothing good to say about this school.
cons: They put this school in at the worst possible time and location.

review_title: Focus on attracting new students rather than keeping the current ones
pros: Nice staff, friendly (for the most part) coworkers, the students that are trying to better themselves are generally good people.  The network of other campuses can work together even though the departments are "competing" against each other for rankings.
cons: Even though I was an educator and not an Admission Rep, I was told I needed sell, sell, sell to keep the lights on.  Potential new students take priority over current students even if they do not end up choosing National College.  Also getting my department's ranking to go up was a priority even though I could never figure out how much each category weighed in since they were clearly not equal.  Some students treat you like a) you make way too much money to associate with which you don't; or b) you should just do all their work for them, like it is too much work for them to remember their personal information and since they've asked you for it once, you should have it memorized.

job_title: Department Chair in South Bend, IN
pros: Offers a lot of opportunity for individuals that are considered non-traditional students to experience college and learn and develop skills in careers that are in demand.
cons:
Focuses on student enrollment and not the students' individual achievement. This is very unfortunate because many of the students that come to the college are performing below average in reading, math and writing skills. As a result, many fall through the crack and drop out.

Hires administrators and managers that are not qualified.  Administrators and managers that are bosses not leaders and do not process the skills or intelligence to develop and guide the staff professionally.

Racist and sexist organization.  Diversity does not matter. Narrow- minded in many aspects of diversity.  Still does not recognize MLK  Day as a holiday.  Turns away qualified minorities in administrative positions.

Pressures and eliminates non-minority administrators that do not display or accept bigot behavior.

Supports known chauvinist to exhibit racist and bigot behavior that are employed with company.

pros: There are no benefits in working at National College unless you care about students. Pay is horrible the way they treat Adjuncts is horrible. It is run like the owner background who was a Green Beret to be commended for his service to our country, but he runs the company like he is the Commander and Chief. In my three years with the all I saw was stupid decision after stupid decision.
cons: All about money and not about students. They sell a dream that ends up costing student around $35,000 for a degree. Many of there programs are no accreditied and for the most part the whole school is a scam. They sell you on a two year degree that ends up being worthless - other carreer colleges you can get the same thing in a 9 months program and they actually get you a job.

review_title: Glad to see this place in the rear view mirror
pros: The people I worked with were mostly pleasant and decent people.  The building was new, and the hours were good.  There are stores near the campus.
cons: People are fired on a whim with absolutely no warning. Staff and faculty that are not fired usually quit after a few months because they figure it's only a matter of time until they get the boot. There is very little direction given on the important things, but fill out a form  improperly, and you'll be in trouble.  The pay is low for a career college which adds to the constant turnover.  Communication between management, staff, and faculty is practically non-existent.

pros: It is pretty laid back and not too micro-managed. The hours are good.
cons: Management will just fire people without warning, it is a business, not a school. There is not much praise to be given except for some certificates that barely ever happen at all. The vice president will visit the campuses but never says a word to anyone. They say that we make the company so much money but we get paid poorly.

pros: Instructors who work in the field and really understand what they are teaching.  A Staff that listens, and understands.  All staff members know each student by name and treat everyone with respect.
cons: The instructors do not have enough power to remove unruly or belligerent students from the class room, they must go through administration, this does not allow for good class flow.

review_title: It is all about the benjamins here. Students are numbers.
pros: Easily, the students that want to be there are the best motivating factor about the job.  Some coworkers are great, others are cowardly, gossipy, and backstabbing much like any other place I guess.  Coworkers include campus directors and down the line from there, adding visiting directors from hq that came in for training.  Pay was satisfactory.
cons: The cowardly, gossipy, backstabbing coworkers, and the high schoolish cliques they created among each other and even student workers.  The alienation is obvious, but overlooked by management because they are a part of the childishness too.  It was ugly how students were dumped from classes in corporate desire to free up space for a certain kind of student ... those not relying on tuition assistance from government grants.  Forced to call prospects bringing military educational benefits multiple times a day to ask them for any updates on when they could start, and many asked to be removed from the call list that they were going to find somewhere else to go.  It was embarrassing calling someone you just called that day and left a message for, or had just spoken to the day before and they had not made a decision, but it was a pushed part of the job and if you do not meet their "non existent" quota, well . . .

pros: There are no pros!
cons: High tuition for students with low a return on investment. Lots of turnover in faculty.  No raise in 10 years. Students are just numbers for enrollment!

review_title: I was library assistant and I enjoy working with the librarian and the students
pros: I enjoy helping the students with the computers and tutoring the ones that needed help with their homework
cons: I was disappointed that I couldn't work there permanent.

review_title: Used to be a good place to work
pros: Great people to work with, loved the students!
cons: No raise in 9 years, took away bonuses, and holiday pay for day after Thanksgiving and Christmas Eve.

pros:
Good way to gain teaching experience.
Flexible day and night schedule.
cons:
A lot of work for little pay.
Policies require you to treat the students like high schoolers. (Attendance tracking, field trips, guest speakers, etc).
The quality of students is lacking.

job_title: Librarian/Assistance to Administration in Bartlett, TN
pros: Everything from working with the staff, students and attending classes there.
cons: None it was a great work experience.

pros: Everyone worked to ensure students' success.  A lot of opportunity to network with employers and the community.
cons: Long hours, not all classes were offered every term.

pros: Decent Pay, Employees work together
cons: Management sucks no direction and no care in the world how we get students just get them

pros: Its a grate college to work with specially because of the team work
cons: The salary is not a competitive one

pros: Faculty cares about students; does much with not a lot of help from HQ.
cons: Many students have no business being in college. Any college.

job_title: Student Services Representative in Lexington-Fayette, KY
pros: Great atmosphere as far as co-workers go.
cons: Alot of decisions made without employee input.

pros: Co-workers were like family and we were all working to help the students.
cons: Many programs moving to online.

pros: Great group of students and staff to work with
cons: not enough support and/or feedback from upper management

pros: Excellent instructors/colleagues who work hard to prepare students for the real world.
cons: I can't think of any.

review_title: Awful Management, high turnover... terrible place to work
pros: It pays the bills as long as you can stay employed.
cons: Very hostile work environment, the students are not getting proper education, high turnover, benefits are very expensive.

review_title: One of the worse company to work for!
job_title: Career Center Director in Columbus, OH
pros: people I work with were great
cons: pay was very low for the amount of work you put in. One of the lowest paying companies, they want you to work for peanuts!

review_title: Employees seen merely as a liability on the corporate profit and loss statement; students seen merely as revenue.
pros: Fellow instructors are good people.
cons: Absolutely no respect for instructors.

pros: Employees were given a one hour lunch
cons: The school is a complete joke

cons: Lowest of pay, no motivation
